metadata.dc:author: Ramírez-Mayans, J A
Mora-Tiscareño, M A
Beteta-Chinchilla, C E
Flores-Calderón, J
Casaubón-Garcín, P
metadata.dc:description: This is the case of a 15 year old adolescent girl who refers recurrent chronic abdominal pain for a period of three months. She was diagnosed as having a chronic pancreatic pseudocyst, seen as a complication of an episode of hemorrhage acute pancreatitis secondary to the administration of L-asparaginase for the treatment of acute lymphoblastic leukemia. The abdominal ultrasonography allowed for a pre-operatory diagnosis to be made. An internal drainage and a cystogastrostomy were the procedures of choice. A review of the literature is included on the physiopathology, clinical history, diagnostic procedures and therapeutic conduct to be followed.
metadata.dc:title: Pseudoquiste pancreático. Informe de un caso y revisión de la literatura.
[Pancreatic pseudocyst. A case report and review of the literature].
metadata.dc:publisher: Boletin medico del Hospital Infantil de Mexico
